byline.contributor: Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Katmandu, Nepal, and Austin Ramzy from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: Outside Katmandu, people are anxious to find out what happened to their relatives and homes after the devastating quake.

headline.print_headline: Across Nepal’s Countryside, Desperate Journeys to Ruined Homes
headline.main: Across Nepal’s Countryside, Desperate Journeys to Ruined Homes After Quake

snippet: Outside Katmandu, people are anxious to find out what happened to their relatives and homes after the devastating quake.
abstract: Villages near epicenter of earthquake in Nepal are badly damaged and difficult to reach, leaving residents largely without outside help; landslides continue and regularly block roads, hindering progress by aid workers.
